channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: 93 burghley road, 14th August
item.description:
The drain outside Acland Burghley school is blocked when rains it backing and the puddles start to go in the the school.

item.title: New lamp installed outside our house, 14th August
item.description:
The new lamp was moved about 2 foot and now really lights up our bedroom, as not only has it been moved it is also much taller. Can a cap be installed? Also, there is now a lot of broken tarmac/holes which need filling in or tarmacking around where the old lamp was removed, as potentially it could be a trip hazard. Many thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albert Road, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ongoing rubbish left outside, 14th August
item.description:
A huge sleeping bag is outside 9 Chancelot Road been there for weeks it’s unsightly and seen rats on it needs to be removed too heavy for a person to lift this property continuously dumps their rubbish outside making the street look like a slum!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chancelot Road, Abbey Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: I am a family support worker for a resident that lives in hastings house se18 5rl, I did a home visit to see one of my disabled clients and she showed me all the rubbish outside her windows she said residents drop things from the windows of the tower block, not only is it unsightly and smelly it is causing flies and vermin., 14th August
item.description:
Litter being dropped from windows by residents causing foul smells rodents and flies, it has been there months. it is on the back side of the block and is fenced off.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mulgrave Road, Charlton Riverside, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fallen branch from inside Danson Park, 14th August
item.description:
A large bough of a tree from inside Danson Park has fallen on top of the park railings and over the footpath that runs between Wellan Close and Lakeside Close. This is a dangerous situation as the bough is approximately 6 feet from the footpath which is also used as a cycle route

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): East Rochester Way, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ridiculous, 14th August
item.description:
Lime bikes scattered all over pavement. The photo doesn't show all of the wreckage because I promised a fellow pedestrian that I wouldn't include her in the photo. Yesterday I helped a blind person down this street - I dread to think how he would have fared today. He would have needed help otherwise he would have been in the gutter. If this carries on I will complain to Lewisham Council - this is getting ridiculous.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Perry Vale, Forest Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet
